name: SBOM-curl-7.29.0
description: Analysis results of the curl component. Version 7.29.0 (arm-openwrt-linux-gnu) did not reveal any directly related known high-risk vulnerabilities. The version string was extracted from the binary file using the strings command.
notes: Although no directly related CVE was found, it is recommended to check whether indirectly dependent libraries (such as OpenSSL) contain vulnerabilities.

description: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
notes: It is recommended to check for the existence of the metainfo.c file to confirm whether the vulnerability exists. Most other CVEs are related to different software or protocols and do not directly affect this component.

name: VULN-CVE-2010-0012
description: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
notes: Although version 2.76 does not explicitly list it, the vulnerability may still exist, and further verification is recommended.

name: SBOM-SQLite-3.8.10.2
description: Analysis results of SQLite component. Version 3.8.10.2 contains known vulnerability (CVE-2015-5895). Version string was identified in the binary through Radare2 analysis.
notes: It is recommended to check for any available updates to the SQLite version to address potential undisclosed vulnerabilities.

name: VULN-CVE-2015-5895
description: SQLite version 3.8.10.2 has known vulnerabilities (CVE-2015-5895), but the specific impact and attack vectors are unknown.
notes: Further investigation is required to determine the specific scope of impact and exploitation conditions of the vulnerability.
